t: Who*pn has believed our report? And*ld to whom has the arm of the Lord*s been revealed?
For*ld He shall grow up before Him as a tender plant, And*ld as a root out of dry ground. He*ld has no form or comeliness; And*ld when we see Him, There*ild is*i no beauty that we should desire Him.
He*ld is despised and rejected by men, A*ld Man of sorrows and acquainted with grief. And*ld we hid, as it were, our*i faces from Him; He*ld was despised, and we did not esteem Him.
Surely*ln He has borne our griefs And*ld carried our sorrows; Yet*ld we esteemed Him stricken, Smitten*ld by God, and afflicted.
But*ld He was*i wounded for our transgressions, He*ild was*i bruised for our iniquities; The*ld chastisement for our peace was*i upon Him, And*ld by His stripes we are healed.
All*ld we like sheep have gone astray; We*ld have turned, every one, to his own way; And*ld the Lord*s has laid on Him the iniquity of us all.
He*ln was oppressed and He was afflicted, Yet*ld He opened not His mouth; He*ld was led as a lamb to the slaughter, And*ld as a sheep before its shearers is silent, So*ld He opened not His mouth.
He*ld was taken from prison and from judgment, And*ld who will declare His generation? For*ld He was cut off from the land of the living; For*ld the transgressions of My people He was stricken.
And*ld they made His grave with the wickedâ€” But*ld with the rich at His death, Because*ld He had done no violence, Nor*ld was*i any*i deceit in His mouth.

Yet*ln it pleased the Lord*s to bruise Him; He*ld has put Him*i to grief. When*ld You make His soul an offering for sin, He*ld shall see His*i seed, He shall prolong His*i days, And*ld the pleasure of the Lord*s shall prosper in His hand.
He*ld shall see the labor of His soul, and*i be satisfied. By*ld His knowledge My righteous Servant shall justify many, For*ld He shall bear their iniquities.

Therefore*ld I will divide Him a portion with the great, And*ld He shall divide the spoil with the strong, Because*ld He poured out His soul unto death, And*ld He was numbered with the transgressors, And*ld He bore the sin of many, And*ld made intercession for the transgressors.
